text: You get a home sense when you enter this place. The service is friendly, the food is quickly served(the longest i've had to wait was 30 min, the least i had to wait is roughly 10 min). What i love the most here is that they serve you with a smile ALL THE TIME!! I swear i have never ever had a bad experience here. The serving is huge, the price is good and it's always fresh. The pictures i'll post will speak for themselves!!

La sauce classic des uf bénédictine est a la fois trop salée et trop sucrée. Le fromage sur l'uf est fade et a ma première boucher il y avait un goût de vinaigre.  Je n'adore pas les patates. Elles goûtent soit le sel très bon marché et/ou il a été confondu avec du sucre. Vous savez le sel est blanc et le sucre aussi. Facile de se tromper.  Les crêpes française avait l'air très bonne. Ils devraient peut être se spécialisée dans les différentes sortes de crêtes a la place de s'aventurer vers plusieurs avenues qu'ils ne maitrise pas très bien.  A leurs avantages et le notre le prix n'ai pas cher dutout.
This is really not anything special. Problem is... All the breakfast restaurants blow in this area. The service is bad, the hostess is insane, and the food is reeaaaaaaaallllyyy average.

I only come here because for some reason or another, it's my best friend's favorite brunch place. I can't stand it. The hostess is insane and pissed off at the world, the waitress I had wouldn't even look at me when I asked for ketchup (let alone actually BRING me the ketchup. I had to get it myself), the food is average, my plate was cold, the coffee is nasty... shall I go on?
